content: Gov. Sarah Palin said Thursday that she would accept only 69 percent of the estimated $930 million dollars that could flow to the state, including $514 million for capital projects and $128 million for a hike in Medicaid reimbursement. Palin said she would accept money that is "timely, targeted and temporary" and does not create strings that will bind the state in the future. "I can't attest to every fund that's being offered the state in the stimulus package will be used to create jobs and stimulate the economy, so I'm requesting only those things that I know will," Palin said at a news conference at the Capitol. "Public discussion will have to ensue on all those other dollars that some will say 'you left on the table.'" Rest here: "http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20090320/ap_on_re_us/palin_stimulus" "A government big enough to give you everything you want, is strong enough to take everything you have." ~ Gerald Ford
reply: Gov. "I can't attest to every fund that's being offered the state in the stimulus package will be used to create jobs and stimulate the economy, so I'm requesting only those things that I know will," Palin said at a news conference at the Capitol. (statemaster.com/graph/eco_wel_cas_tot_fam-ec...oads-total-families)%5B/URL%5D]www.statemaster.com/graph/eco_wel_cas_tot_fam-ec...oads-total-families) Palin is right. You know, the one noone in the US can afford. I would love to get some financial help for the Animal Shelter where I work, but not from this stupid stimulus plan. It is only going to bleed us and our children dry. What is the point anyway and why can't people make it on their own, without the governments assistance. (not they are actually helping anything)Are we really just a country full of failures and cowards? Sometimes I really do wonder.

content: By your own stats, Alaska has a higher percentage of it's population on welfare than does Michigan Simple math: MI: 75,706 on welfare out of a population of 10 million - 0.757% of the population on welfare. title: Palin rejects nearly 30 percent of stimulus funds

content: Gov. Sarah Palin said Thursday that she would accept only 69 percent of the estimated $930 million dollars that could flow to the state, including $514 million for capital projects and $128 million for a hike in Medicaid reimbursement. Palin said she would accept money that is "timely, targeted and temporary" and does not create strings that will bind the state in the future. "I can't attest to every fund that's being offered the state in the stimulus package will be used to create jobs and stimulate the economy, so I'm requesting only those things that I know will," Palin said at a news conference at the Capitol. "Public discussion will have to ensue on all those other dollars that some will say 'you left on the table.'" Rest here: "http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20090320/ap_on_re_us/palin_stimulus" "A government big enough to give you everything you want, is strong enough to take everything you have." ~ Gerald Ford
